verses.verse: Wisdom <S%H2454><s%> hath builded <S%H1129><s%> her house <S%H1004><s%>; She hath hewn out <S%H2672><s%> her seven <S%H7651><s%> pillars <S%H5982><s%>:
She hath killed <S%H2873><s%> her beasts <S%H2874><s%>; She hath mingled <S%H4537><s%> her wine <S%H3196><s%>; She hath also furnished <S%H6186><s%> her table <S%H7979><s%>:
She hath sent forth <S%H7971><s%> her maidens <S%H5291><s%>; She crieth <S%H7121><s%> upon <S%H1610><s%> the highest places <S%H4791><s%> of the city <S%H7176><s%>:
Whoso is simple <S%H6612><s%>, let him turn in <S%H5493><s%> hither <S%H2638><s%>: As for him that is void of understanding <S%H3820><s%>, she saith to him <S%H559><s%>,
Come <S%H3212><s%>, eat <S%H3898><s%> ye of my bread <S%H3899><s%>, And drink <S%H8354><s%> of the wine <S%H3196><s%> which I have mingled <S%H4537><s%>.
Leave <S%H5800><s%> off <S%H6612><s%>, ye simple ones <S%H2421><s%>, and live; And walk <S%H833><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> of understanding <S%H998><s%>.

He that correcteth <S%H3256><s%> a scoffer <S%H3887><s%> getteth <S%H3947><s%> to himself reviling <S%H7036><s%>; And he that reproveth <S%H3198><s%> a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man getteth himself a blot <S%H3971><s%>.
Reprove <S%H3198><s%> not a scoffer <S%H3887><s%>, lest he hate <S%H8130><s%> thee <S%H3198><s%>: Reprove a wise man <S%H2450><s%>, and he will love thee <S%H157><s%>.

Give <S%H5414><s%> instruction to a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H2449><s%>, and he will be yet wiser: Teach <S%H3045><s%> a righteous <S%H6662><s%> man <S%H3254><s%>, and he will increase in learning <S%H3948><s%>.
The fear <S%H3374><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> is the beginning <S%H8462><s%> of wisdom <S%H2451><s%>; And the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One is understanding <S%H998><s%>.
For by me thy days <S%H3117><s%> shall be multiplied <S%H7235><s%>, And the years <S%H8141><s%> of thy life <S%H2416><s%> shall be increased <S%H3254><s%>.
If thou art wise <S%H2449><s%>, thou art wise <S%H2449><s%> for thyself <S%H3887><s%>; And if thou scoffest, thou alone shalt bear it <S%H5375><s%>.
The foolish <S%H3687><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> is clamorous <S%H1993><s%>; She is simple <S%H6615><s%>, and <S%H1077><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> nothing <S%H4100><s%>.
And she sitteth <S%H3427><s%> at the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house <S%H1004><s%>, On a seat <S%H3678><s%> in the high places <S%H4791><s%> of the city <S%H7176><s%>,
To call <S%H7121><s%> to them that pass <S%H5674><s%> by <S%H3474><s%>, Who go right on their ways <S%H734><s%>:
Whoso is simple <S%H6612><s%>, let him turn in <S%H5493><s%> hither <S%H2638><s%>; And as for him that is void of understanding <S%H3820><s%>, she saith to him <S%H559><s%>,
Stolen <S%H1589><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> are sweet <S%H4985><s%>, And bread <S%H3899><s%> eaten in secret <S%H5643><s%> is pleasant <S%H5276><s%>.
But he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not that the dead <S%H7496><s%> are there <S%H7121><s%>; That her guests are in the depths <S%H6012><s%> of Sheol <S%H7585><s%>.
